11211112111122.title: One step for Lucy, and one Giant Headache for me

112111121111222.content:
Putting your hand over your eyes, you saw past the bright light and into the store. You inhaled deeply, taking in your surroundings. "Ah, smell like freedom," you said, smiling. It was then you noticed all the shoe boxes in all the racks. It didn't take you long to figure out this was a shoe store. You shook your head, laughing. No wonder why Lucy was screaming so loudly back there.

You then saw a heaven every person with a foot fetish would kill for. There were so many pairs of shoes, socks, and barefeet that you could barely count them all. You saw a very pretty girl, at about the age of 15, taking off her shoes. "Man," she said in a whiny tone, "these things are killing me." She took off her shoe, and you watched as it tumbled on top of you. You gagged at how strong the smell was, but after that, you smiled.

Just as you were enjoying your new situation, the shoe was lifted, and you saw the eyes of the girl above you. They had a sense of boredom, then of surprise, then malice. You didn't like that expression one bit, and a new shred of fear enveloped within you. She lifted her foot, and you were just able to jump out of the way. "So bug, how do you like my feet?" she grinned. As you ran, she stomped it right in front of you. "So, you think you can get away? Just like that?" She grabbed you, showing you the bottom of her sock. "You see this foot right here? Do you know how many bugs got crushed," she snapped her fingers on her other hand, "just like that under it?"

You began to profuse a lot, both from the heat from her foot and the dread of this bratty teenager. "Maybe we work this out?" you uttered softly. You were surprised when you were moved away from her foot. With one hand, she took off her socks, revealing her barefeet. You breathed a sigh of relief, until you realized what was happening. She set you on the floor, and the shadow of her foot enveloped you. She waved her hand at you. "Say hi to your bug friends for me," she giggled.

You shielded your eyes, writing your will in your mind until you heard an unfamiliar voice. "Honey, it's time to go home."
"But mom..."
"No buts young lady, when I say we're going, we're going."
"Can I at least do this one thing really qui-" There was a shuffle of feet coming closer, and a scream. "Ow! Mom, my ear!"
"I did say it was time to go home, didn't I?"
"I guess..."
"Well, put on your shoes, get the new shoes you wanted and we'll get going."

As the conversation was taking place, you had to think of a hiding spot. Your brain cells accelerating, a lightbulb popped into your head.
112111121111222.title: I Love the Smell of a Girl's Feet in the Morning

1121111211112222.content:
You hid and crouched under the shoe rack, concealed in the shadows. You watched as the girl put on her socks and shoes. When she was finished, she started to look around at the ground. Then, she glanced at your direction and started reaching out to you! You thought she would grab you, but she only grabbed the shoe box above you. She took a final glance at the floor, an expression of disappointment upon her face. She left the store, the ringing of the bell of the door flooding your ears.

That was pleasant, you thought to yourself. You decided that you had enough of this shoe store, and thought of another place to visit. It was then you had an idea of somewhere to go, and a grin plastered across your face.

***

Well, here I am. After much walking and stealing borrowing some transportation (Who knew mini bicycles from the toy store nextdoor would be so useful!), you finally arrived at your school. Most of the boys dropped out, leaving you in a school where you were the only boy. You knew that, just like America, this was the land of oppertunity. The sky was dark, but beams of light faintly showed; dawn was approaching, and so was the start of school. What am I going to do while I wait, you wondered. I guess I'll make a tent or something. You rode your bike across the blacktop towards the benches. You grabbed a twig, and drew a circle diameter in the sand. Dragging a couple of maple leaves, you formed them into a tent shape. Just like constructing a sandcastle, you formed a chair that was a little too sensative to be sat in. Tiny bits of bushes lined a pathway to your house, and gravel from the playground filled the pathway.

You walked back a few steps, wiping the sweat off your brow and admiring your work. That was some tiring work, but I finally got it finished. Suddenly, a flipflop came crashing down, crushing the home that took you a long time (in your opinion) to create. The sound of pulverized leaves and sand filled your ears. You got on your knees, banging your fist on the ground. "Why?!" you vented to the sand repeatedly. You looked up, wanting to know the villian that would do such a thing.

Your fit of rage then transformed to that of awe. She had straight, auburn hair, coffee brown eyes, and a smooth face. Whoever she was, she must've been a new student since you'd never seen her before.

She looked down, and smiled. It wasn't a smile of intent, however, but of friendliness. She waved to you. "Hey there, little bug." She lifted her flipflop, a curious look on her face. "Is...is that a house?" She glanced back at you, taking a closer look. "Wait....you're not a bug." She grabbed you with her hand, lifting you to her eyes. She gasped. “How’d you get to this size?” You opened your mouth to speak, but were interrupted. “No, it’s okay. I can’t believe I almost killed you though! I’m so sorry…” The bell rang, signaling the beginning of school. She expressed a show of concern. “Hey, if it’s alright with you, we can talk at recess. Okay?”

You nodded. “Okay, where can I put you?” She looked for a hiding place, but just decided to put you in her backpack.
1121111211112222.title: Dang Nabbit, My House!

choices: Decide to escape once you wake up
11211112111122221.content:
You saw as the last bit of light above you withdrew, the zipper closed. You scratched your head, wondering what to do when you were caught off guard by the sudden movement around you, knocking you down. You tried to get up, but just ended up smacking right onto notebooks and textbooks. Stars circling around your head, this reminded you of the ride you took in Lucy's shoe; it was very nausiating and painful.

Just when you thought you pass out, everything stopped. The ground stopped shaking, and so did all the objects around you. With one hand on a textbook cover, you stood up, knees wobbling. Everything was spinning and blurry, but you were eventually able to see clearly and regain your balance. With both hands, you dusted yourself off and glanced up.

It was against you better judgement, but you decided that you'd at least do something instead of waiting around for recess. Surveying the area, you stumbled upon a purple pencilbox. A lightbulb popped into your head, and the gears of thinking started whirling. Opening the pencilbox, you took out a whole bunch of rectangular erasers and stack them upon eachother. Eventually, you were able to reach the zipper and take a peak of where you were.

Lots of desks, people, and a teacher in the front led to only one thing; a classroom. The air conditioner could be heard at full blast. You gazed at all the girls, every single one of them wearing sandals. You smiled, knowing you did the right thing by coming here. Getting up, you slid down the backpack, going to the feet of the girl in front of you.

What you liked about these feet was that they were french pedicured. You climbed on top of the sandal, relishing the adrenalizing moment. You sniffed the air, breathing in that familiar aroma that you loved so much. You did make one mistake however; you decided to kiss her toes.

Going up to her biggest toe, you kissed it. Just as you did, her foot responded, lifting and grabbing you with all her toes. She rolled you all of the insole of her sandal, the flesh of her sole semi-comforting you. You were both frightened and having a blast at the same time; just like a rollercoaster at an amusement park. Suddenly, you felt the pressure of her foot baring down on you. That feeling of excitement starting to die down, being replaced with 100% fear.

You sighed, knowing that this was it. This was how you've always dreamed to die, crushed underneath a girl's foot. You didn't realize until now that it would be this painful. You closed you eyes, predicting that you'll end up pulverized as a tiny blood stain under her sole.

Then, a miracle happened. The teacher's barely audible voice asked something, and the pressure was released. The girl above you answered back. You took this time to jump forward, just before her foot came crashing down onto the sandal. You wiped the sweat off your forehead, being thankful for the close call. You hopped down from the sandal, and walked back to the backpack, a little shaken up. You climbed up, opened the zipper, and dropped down. Then, you sat down, analyzing what you just did.

"Was it worth it?" your conscience asked.
"Yeah," you faintly grinned whispering to yourself before you dozed off, "it was worth it."
11211112111122221.title: It was Worth It

112111121111222211.content:
You didn't know how long you slept, but you jolted forward when you heard the bell ring. It then came to your mind that it was time for recess. As quick as lightning itself, you sprinted over to the tape, ripped some off, and taped yourself to a sturdy textbook. With no time to spare, your surroundings and the ground beneath you started to move again. You padded yourself on the back (well, in your mind; it was difficult to do it physically.), and enjoyed the ride. Instead of a rollercoaster, it felt similar to a carousel, sort of.

After a few minutes, you could hear the zipper moving and a hand laying flat at the bottom of the backpack. You were hesitant at first, but just shrugged it off and hopped onto it. You were lifted high into the air, the eyes of the girl from before on you. "Hey," she smiled, whispering.
"H-hello."
"Oh, so you can talk! That's great." She dug her foot in the sand. "Anyways, my name is Larissa." She pulled out a cracker crumb from her pocket. "You hungry?"
"Starving!" You took the crumb gratefully, gnawing on it with full force.

Larissa giggled. "Oh, your so cute!" She set you down on the table, and watched you. Then, she took off her flip-flops and put them in her backpack. "I like to feel the sand between my toes," she explained. "By the way, how did you end up this small?"
You diverted your attention away from the crumb. "I-I have no clue. I was just walking at the park, and I blacked out. When I woke up, everything's 100 times bigger."
"Well, what are you doing over here at school?"
"I was..." you tugged your shirt, "uh...looking for supplies. Yes, that's it."
"Supplies?"
"Yeah, like this," you lifted your cracker crumb.
"Ah, okay. What did you do on your way from the park?"
You smiled nervously. "I...well....you see..."

"Hey look, it's the new kid," a feminine voice called out. Larissa started to run, but was stopped in her tracks. You hid under a giant leaf you found, watching what was happening. "Where do you think you're going?"
"Please," she pleaded, "let me go."
"And why would I do that?" Two other girls came up, and
"Hey, my backpack!"
"See you later, loser."

Larissa slumped on the ground, near the tree. "Man, those jerks. Why did they have to pick on me?"
"It's okay. They probably won't make it far in life anyway."
"Yeah, I guess so." The bell rang, alarming her. "Wait, where am I going to put you now? I lost my backpack."
"Umm," you walked back and forth on her hand. Just like the genius you were, you came up with another idea. "Hey, this is your last class right?"
"Yeah, then we go home."
"Tell me, what class is it?"
"P.E. Why?"

***

"You sure you'll be okay in there?"
"Yeah, I'll be fine."
"Okay, I'll be back." The locker door closed, and luckily, it wasn't too dark since this was one of the lockers with all the holes.
Once she was gone, you opened the door. “It won’t hurt to explore the school a bit.” You checked your watch. 2:30. That meant you had 40 minutes until the girls came back. You walked out of the locker room, which led you outside. Everything was as you remembered it when you were larger: basketball hoops, trees, the field. Then, something caught your eye. A strange figure laid against a tree. Whoever it was about your size, and seemed to be in distress.

You walked over to that direction, and was shocked to see it was another person! He grabbed his leg, some blood soaked into his pants. “Th-there’s not much time,” he said between clenched teeth, breathing heavily. “We need to get to…to get out of here.”
“Hey, you okay man?”
“We need to move NOW!” he started to get up, but stumbled and hit the dirt facefirst.
“Wha-”
The ground started to shake, and you could hear the chatter between a group of girls. “Hey,” said one of them, “I’m tired. How about we sit right here?”
“Sure,” the others said in unison. Before they sat down, one of them screamed. “Eww, bugs!”
The rest of them started to scream too. You carried the man, his arm over your shoulder and started to sprint too. You came within breathing distance of being crushed by the girls sandals, but with luck, you were able to reach the grass, and stay camouflaged.

“It’s 300 paces north of here,” the man murmured weakly. You nodded and continued forward. Not long after, you reached something that looked like an ant hill. “Don’t worry; we cleared out all the insects long ago.” You climbed up and at the top seemed to be a makeshift elevator. An old fasion one at that since it seemed to operate on a pulley system with a rope. The man pulled at the rope downward, continuing so. The elevator started to move down with his pulling.

“So, how long have you been shrunk?” he asked casually.
“Huh?”
“I said, how long have you been shrunk?”
“Well, maybe two days.”
“Ah, so you’re a new timer then.”
“Wait…what are you saying?”
“My friend, let me behold you to this.” You then saw, after a few seconds of downwards elevation, an amazing sight. An underground city! It all was to scale with your size, and lots of people that were shrunk were there too! You could only gaze in awestruck amazement until you heard, “Come on, this ain’t no time for sight seeing.”

You walked with him down a few tunnels and ended up in a dimly lit room. On the walls were maps of your town that had Xs on them. A desk stood in the middle of the room with someone who wore clothes like a general from an army. He had a scar on his right cheek, and a cold stare.


“Who’s this?” the general asked, his voice rough.
“This,” the man beside you began saying, “is the guy that saved my life, sir.”
“Hmm,” he walked back and forth by his desk. “what happened to the rest of your men?”
“All dead sir.”
“Damn it!” he banged his fist on the desk. “Both you and me know we can’t afford to lose anymore men.” He sat down on his chair, his head resting on his left hand. “Send some troops tomorrow and try again.”
The man nodded. “Yes sir, I won’t fail you sir.”
He pointed out. “Get to the medic room and fix up your legs.”
He nodded and left the room. Then, the general looked up at you. “I’m glad you saved his life.” He got up and gazed at a dusty portrait of a young man. “How long have you been shrunk?”
“Uh,” you stammered, “2 days.”
“Ha, I’ve been like this for 25 years boy.” He rubbed his thumb gently on the portrait and sat back onto his chair. Then he rummaged through his drawers, and pulled out a book. He glided it over the desk to you. “This here,” he chuckled, “is something I’ve recorded over those 25 years.”

“How Giantesses Kill.” You read aloud. You raised an eyebrow, and opened it. Every page had a detailed desciption of how you could die by a girl. Some you didn't know you could die that way until you read the description.
The general eyed you while you flipped the pages. "You can't trust them."
"Huh?"
"You can't trust the giant girls aboveground. All they want is to kill you for their own amusement."
You started to agree with him, then an image of Larissa popped into your mind. "Maybe a few?"
"No, not a single one of them." He pointed to the book. "Some of my best men died in situations that book describes. Eaten, butt crushed, crushed between their boobs, crushed by their feet, you name it."
You shuddered at the thought.
"Yeah. I'm the creator of this beautiful city you see here. Everyday, I've watched shrunken come in. Sometimes they stay, sometimes they don't. It's usually up to them." He turned to you. "You're welcome to stay here if you wish anytime you want."

You're watch started to beep. You checked it and the time showed it was 3:05. You only had 5 minutes to return to the locker room! "Well, I'll consider it, but I have to go."
"Ah, why so soon?"
"I need to get somewhere, but I fear that I won't have much time."
"Well, you can always come back if you'd like. We can always use men like you in our troop brigade. If you're in the hurry, I think I know the perfect thing to help you."

***

"Are you sure this is safe?"
"Of course. Our troops use it all the time to get from place to place." He lit the fuse to the turbo jet paper glider.
"I'm having second thoughts about this."
"Have a nice flight!" The turbo rockets activated, and you screamed as you flew at an unbelievable speed. You did loops around in the air, and then flew down.
"How do I control this thiiinnngggg?" you stuttered. Before you hit the ground, you pulled up and were just able to avoid a crash landing. You shifted left and right. You squinted your eyes and flew into the locker room. You let go and did sumersaults on the concrete floor. The glider ran out of fuel and smashed into the floor as well. You climbed up the lockers and got into yours. Right when you closed the door, the bell rang and not long after, the girls came running in.

Larissa came and opened the locker door. "Hey, glad to see you. Probably bored you to death waiting huh?"
"Yep, very boring." You faked a yawn.
"Well, class is over, so we can go home now. Want to come with?"
"Sure thing."
112111121111222211.title: A Secret Society

choices: to be her foot slave...for now
1121111211112222111.content:
Larissa's hands were cupped around you as she strolled along the sidewalk. You could hear the faint thumps of her feet and the roaring of cars going by as she walked. You thought long and hard about what the general said. What did he mean by you couldn't trust them? Not a single one? You knew that Larissa wouldn't do anything that book showed you. Would she? You shook your head. You were still going to accomplish your goal of seeing every girls' feet no matter how dangerous the task.

It wasn't much longer until she went up to and opened the door to her house. After she went in and closed it, you heard the click of the locking mechanism. You were placed onto a cluttered coffee table as Larissa laid on the couch. It didn't occur to you until then that she was barefoot the whole time. Now that you thought about it, you didn't get to experience her feet except for the fact for when she almost crushed you at the beginning of school. You reached into your pocket, and smiled when you fished out your phone. By mere coincidence, the phone company cut you off since you didn't pay your phone bill the day you were shrunk, so it seemed completely useless to you. However, since you devoted your life to looking for feet, you decided it wouldn't hurt to take pictures of them along the way. Aiming the phone, you captured a perfect picture of Larissa's slightly dirty, and dusty soles. You looked up from your camera and she turned her head to you, mildly bored. “You don’t mind if I take a picture of your face right?”

“Not at all.” You took a snapshot of her face also. Why, you ask? It’s a bonus to every foot enthusiast, including you, if you’re able to see the face of the person showing their feet. You made a digital folder labeled ‘Larissa’ and put both images into it.

Larissa sighed heavily. "I can't believe Ms. Larson gave us that much homework." You noddingly agreed, knowing all too well the reputation that teacher had for giving out truckloads of homework. "Do you know anything about chemistry?" she asked.
"Not really."
She sighed. "Well, I guess it doesn't really matter anyway. All my stuff was in my backpack." She then stood up. "I'll be right back; I'm going to see if the T.V. remote is in my sister's room."
Sister?, you began to ask, but by then she was already out of earshot.

Suddenly, thunderous knocks enveloped your ears. A muffled voice you could faintly remember shouted from the front door. The lock unturned, and your blood turned as cold as a popsicle in a freezer. It was the bratty girl from the shoe store! "Larissa, why'd you lock the door? You know I don't usually bring the house key with me." Thankfully, the table was a mess, so you just hid under a few papers.

Larissa came back. "Oh hey," she smiled nervously, "what are you doing home so early?"
"Me and Mom were speed shopping today." She sat on the couch and plopped her feet right next to you! You almost yelped, but quickly covered your mouth.
"Where's Mom?"
"She went to take care of Grandpa. She'll be gone for today. Here." She handed her a piece of paper.
Larissa raised his eyebrow. "What's this?"
She turned on the T.V. "A list of chores to do."
Larissa quietly read the note. "It says here that we'll be splitting the work." She looked up from the note. "You're going to help me, right?"
"Nope." She began surfing the channels.
"But Mom-"
"Mom doesn't know you snuck out when you weren't supposed to last week. It would be pretty unfortunate if that information accidently slipped out, huh?"
"Well, I...," flustered, Larissa stomped out of the room.

Moving slowly, you crawled underneath the paper. You were making progress, and you thought you were actually going to escape unnoticed until felt the paper above you lift, and those toes grasp you from above. "Ah bug, you thought you would escape from me? I'm afraid not." She rubbed her chin. "Let's see, what can I do to you? I can squash you, but I feel that you need something a little more. Maybe a night in my old gym socks?" She inspected you a little closer, and her face turned to complete shock. "Hey, you're not a bug...you're a human!"
You nodded. "It's a long story."
"Oh, and you could talk too! Tell me," she asked flirtatiously, "do you like what you see?"

You scanned her up and down. Even though she was a total jerk, it was obvious she was beautiful. As much as you resented her, you nodded.
"If my theory stands correct, every guy has some of fetish." She made herself more comfortable. "Yours would be-"
"I like feet." you blurted out, unconsciously.
"Reeeeeallly? Well, I'll give you two choices.”
"I can squash you under my foot, and I'll forget you ever existed...OR you can become my foot slave. Either way, I get some form of enjoyment out of it."
After some thinking, you decided....
1121111211112222111.title: You Again!

11211112111122221112.content:
You certainly did want to continue your adventure. You gave a sigh, and looked at her. As much as you hated her, you swallowed your pride and said yes. "Oh, this is going to be so much fun," she grinned. You didn't like that look as it gave you a cold chill down your spine. Also, it alerted the Stay away as far as possible sensors in your brain. "By the way, you can call me Jessica."
"Okay Jess-" her toe collided into your chest, crashing you into the floor.
"You will only talk when I ask of you or when I give you permission to speak."
You stood up, and pointed a finger at her. "Hey, that-" With that, she rammed you again, knocking you back down on the dense coffee table top. With a cautious stance, you stood up, put your hands in your pockets, and stayed silent.
"Now, let me clarify something real quick." She pulled out a bag of chips. Taking a handful, she munched in contemplation. "Okay, if you disobey me in any way or do a horrible job at whatever task I give you, you'll be given a punishment. How bad that punishment is will be dependent on my mood." She took another handful of chips, and munched again. "However, if you're a good slave, I'll think of maybe giving you a reward."

With that, she stuck her right sole in front of you. "For your first task, you'll be cleaning my sole."
Seeing the very sole that almost crushed you in the shoe store from yesterday, an inner flame within you rose to a dangerous level. Unfortunately, it got to the point where your stubborness and resentment snapped and took over. "No."
Just like that, her cheery mood turned cold. "What?"
"I said no!" You stomped in fury. "I hate how you treat people, and I hate your attitude as well. I'm a human being, and I fully well expect to be treated as such!"
She scoffed, then sighed. With two fingers, she pinched the back of your shirt, carrying you. She walked to her room and pulled something from under the bed. Your eyes watered from the stench. It could bring grown men to their knees. The toughest of the tough would run as fast as their legs could carry them in the other direction. If I had to use words to describe it, I would call it a second hell.

"You like that?" she smirked. "That, my friend, is my gym sock." Then the realization of what was going to happen next hit you like a fully-loaded brick truck speeding at 100 miles per hour. Hands clasped, you did what anyone would do. "Please!" you pleaded intensely, "anything but in there."
"I'm afraid not. Just remember that this is what you asked for when you didn't do what was asked of you."
Your worst fears became a reality as the grip on you was released and you fell inside. She lifted the sock, sending you rolling into the toe section. You didn't even know it was humanely possible to have a scent magnified that much. You began to gag, and searched franticly for something to get a footing on to climb out of there. Sadly, there was nothing to grip onto.
"Get me out of here!" you screamed with all the lungpower you had. This led to the air entering inside you. Wheezing, you pounded at the wall with feeble attempts. Your side blurred, and darkened. On your back, you reached out to the faint light above until your arm went limp at your side.

***

"Ow, my head," you mumbled, feeling the heaviness of a hangover. Your surroundings were shrouded in darkness and silence. You stood up, and started to walk forward until you were jolted by an invisible wall. Putting your hand on it, and observing the lid above you, it was then you knew you were in a glass jar. Jessica's faint snores could be heard as she laid in bed. The door creaked slightly, and a beam of light flashed forward. It searched all over until it came upon the jar you were in. You shielded your eyes with your hands. After that, you smiled wholeheartedly. The dark figure holding the flashlight was no other than Larissa!

She looked over to her snoring sister, and back at you. She smiled as well, and grabbed the job. Sneaky as a mouse, she tip-toed out and into her room. It wasn't until she turned on her bedroom light that you noticed how exhausted she looked. Her face had splotches of dirt along with her hair, which didn't so great either. She unscrewed the jar, and cupped her hands around you. She lifted you up, and held you in front of her face. "You okay?"
"I should ask the same thing," you replied worryingly.
"I'm fine." She glanced at her bedroom door, then back to you. "I'm so sorry about my sister. She's kinda...well, you know." She put you on the pillow next to her.
"Yeah."
Larissa yawned silently, hands behind her head, and laid down on the pillow that was beside yours. "Don't worry about my sister. I'll hide you from her whenever she comes around." She then switched the lamp off, turned to her side, and went to sleep. Fishing out your phone again, you went through the digital folder, and smiled at the pictures of Larissa and her feet.

A lightbulb then flashed through your mind. If you had Larrisa's pictures, then why not take some of her sister? You shook away the horrifying images from earlier out of your head. As much as you hated it, she was beautiful and so were her feet. Her soles and toes would make an excellent collection to your adventure. With renewed vigor, you climbed down, jogged across the wooden floor, and entered your "master's" lair. Her snoring could be heard, and you walked towards the sound with fear, hate, and lust.

Climbing up the bedsheets that were drapped at the side of her bed, you reached the top. Her feet were within your sight, illuminated by the faint moonlight that was shed by the open window. You could feel the draft of the frosty air as it touched your face oh so delicately. You pulled out your phone, and took snapshots of her soles and, once you were able to get into position, her magnificent toes. You felt overwealming feelings while doing so. Steadily walking, you came up to her face. You sighed, wondering how such a wonderful looking girl could have something so hideous inside her. You aimed with precision, and took a picture of her. To your horror, she twitched slightly. Fortunately, it was a false alarm.

You knew your luck would run out sooner or later though. Just as you were returning to Larissa's room, you turned back, climbed up the drapes, and stepped onto the window ledge. With your heroic pose, dashing smile, and good looks, you decided to investigate the general's colony a little bit more.
11211112111122221112.title: Socks...Why'd it have to be Socks

choices: Refuse to take part in his plan
112111121111222211121.content:
You climbed down the window to the outside. It was a bit chilly, but that wasn't going to stop you. You wondered how you were going to make it all the way to the school when an idea popped into your head. "It's crazy, but it's the only one I got," you thought to yourself. You walked out into the sidewalk, and waited patiently. People walked by, and passed. Then, a girl came by with her sneakers. She was walking in the direction of your school and had a backpack on. Your school did nighttime tutoring, and you were glad now that they did. "You only got one shot at this; don't screw it up."

You leaped forward, and with lady luck on your side, were able to grab onto her shoelace. If you jumped a second later, you would've jumped right under her shoe and become acquainted with the sidewalk as a pancake. You hung on tight, and the bumpiness didn't settle well with your vision and stomach. You held on just a little longer before you fell. Dizziness and lightheadedness kicked in, but they went away after a bit. You walked to where the colony was and for the first time, saw people digging around and carrying sand into the elevator. You went with one group and descended downwards. You saw the bright, bustling city, once again, right before your eyes.

Instead of going straight to the general, you decided it wouldn't hurt to take a detour through the city. People walked to and fro just as if they were going through a normal day. All of them were different ages of men. They wore straggly and unkempt apparel, but they didn't seem to mind. Merchants chanted their wares, the scent of spices filled the air, people chatted casually in hangout spots. You saw the transactions within the marketplace. The currency was an odd spectacle as it seemed to resemble rectangular shards of glass. Then, your eyes rested upon a huge, shining sphere.

"Giant pearl," an auctioneer shouted from on top of a crate boldly, "12 shards of glass!" People crowded around and shouted prices.
"15!"
"16!"
"18!"
"21!"
"23!"
"We got 23 shards here. Will anyone match it? Going once. Going twice. Sold to the gentleman in the red vest!"

You walked past, and entered another section of the town. There was silence, and a dust dune rolled past you; there seemed to be no one here. "Where did everyone go?" you asked yourself. Then, a slight noise of someone talking fell upon your ears. You walked towards it, and stumbled upon what looked like a makeshift structure. Entering, you found all of the people in that section of the town on their knees, bowing towards 2 gigantic flip-flops. You gazed in awe and wonder at the scene. Then, enormous brass bells rang above, and the crowd filtered out of the building. A person stood in front of you, just noticing that you were there.

"What is this place?" you asked him.
"This? This is a club or hangout for foot enthusiasts." He pointed behind him. "That over there are flip-flops from a giant girl." He pointed towards the ceiling and walked towards the shoes. "Every day, this part of town gathers around to worship the only connection we have from the feet above. Come over here." He motioned you closer. "Put your nose right here." You did so, and to your surprise, a strong, familiar scent filled your nostrils. You could definitely smell a young teenage girl's foot upon it. You had a feeling on whose they were, but you couldn't put your finger on it.

"We just got them a couple of hours ago," he said warily. "Some soldiers found it and were able to bring it in here. Don't ask how we were able to fit it inside."
You gave a nod. "Ah, okay. Just so you know, I'm an enthusiast myself."
The man smiled. "Welcome to the club then." He stood in the doorway. "I'll be heading out. Take care of yourself." Then, he walked out of sight.

***

You had reached the office were the general resided. Opening the door, he grinned at you, exhaling some smoke. "You came back, huh?"
"Yep."
"Alrighty then. You proved to me you're quick on your feet, and strong enough to carry a soldier away from a danger. I'll let you in on something." He pulled out a map and pointed to a few circled locations. "The soldier you saved was receiving supplies from these locations. If you didn't know, these locations are all treasure troves as well as death traps. We got your cafeteria right here, a place where we get our food, and the classrooms, where we get our wares to help suppot our economy."

"Isn't that stealing, sir?" you asked casually.
He stared at you silently, then gave a chuckle, moving his head from left to right. "Why, in the hell, would you care if we stole something from those...monsters." He then proceeded to furiously swipe the things on his desk in one movement. "We're trying to survive while they're up there, spoiled; they don't know what it's like to be so tiny, watching your back every second of your life, not knowing every second could your last. What it's like to see your comrades..." A tear glided slowly across his cheek. "to see your comrades squished slowly, and mercilessly under their soles, a smile of pure enjoyment upon their faces as they grinded their feet into those you traveled and talked with for so long."

He took a few deep breathes, then became calm. "Tomorrow, that's all going to change. Take a look at this." He guided you to a scientific research facility. Scientists and workers were in a whirlwind of activity. Inside the glass window, you could see they were constructing something, but you weren't sure what it was. "That, my friend, is the bomb that will pave the way to a road of safety and the ability to live our normal lives," the general proclaimed with confidence in his tone.
"How?"
"Well, I don't want to have to go through al the details with you, but it'll cause all human life on the surface to go," he snapped his fingers, "poof, just like that. All structures, along with everything else will be shrunken by the explosion."
Your jaw dropped upon hearing his plans. "That's crazy! Anyways, we'd eventually all die of old age."
The general stood with an amused expression. "Of course. One thing we did found out though, was that 5% of the girls affected by the bomb would shrink instead of dieing. A remarkable discovery if I do say so myself."

"What about the people, our size, above the surface?” You asked, concerned.
He sighed. “Unfortunately, they’d die from the effects as well.”
“You…you can’t do this.”
He stood with no remorse expressed upon his face whatsoever. "I shall do what I must for the greater good of our civilization."
"This is asinine! You're murdering innocent people!"
His ice cold eyes stared into your soul, and his voice was spoke with utmost rigidness. "We have to strike before they wipe us all out first. Now, either you're with us, or against us. What will it be?"
112111121111222211121.title: Plans of Mass Destruction

1121111211112222111212.content:
"I'm sorry general, but this is madness," you stated boldly.
"Madness?" His eyes wandered to his soldiers behind him, then back towards you, amused. "I'm not going to kick you into an endless pit. However, what I am going to do is this." He snapped his fingers, and two guards grabbed your hands and put them behind you back. "We can't let you go. After all, you've seen too much!" He pointed to a tunnel. "Take him to the brig."

"You will regret this!" you yelled as you were dragged away. "I won't let you succeed!" You were taken through a system of dark tunnels, and eventually thrown into a jail cell. You could barely see the soldiers' faces, let alone their entire appearance; that was how ill-lighted the place really was. You took the time to remember the memories you had with giantesses. Sure, they were dangerous, and almost snuffed out your life many times before, but there was something about them, something magical. It was if you couldn't stay away from them, or their divine, and wonderful feet. It was a curse, and a blessing.

Although what the general was doing was diabolical, you felt a little bad for him, seeing all his friends die under some giant girls' feet. Experiences like that could drive people to insanity, which is probably what happened to him. Now, he wants revenge, but you always knew revenge was never an option. Even after he's killed all of them, he would never truly feel satisfied. There would still be a deep, pitch black hole in his heart. You took psychology classes, so you knew what you were talking about.

Suddenly, the two guards in front of you fell to the floor, groaning. Another silhouette appeared, and they unlocked your cage. "Come quickly," the silhouette whispered as they dashed away. You followed, and with some sneaking around, were able to escape the base. You were taken to the club with the gigantic flipflops. Your rescuer reveled himself, exposing none other than the guy you met in the club a while back. He smiled. "During my normal life, I was a scout and spy for the US 8th espionage regiment in Korea." He took out some documents and spread them across the surface of the flipflops. "I heard what happened between you and the general. As you can see here, these documents detail his plans of time schedules and setting. He'll be setting off the bomb in about 8 hours sharp on the surface on Saturday, tomorrow."
"Why the surface?" you asked, a bit puzzled.
"He wanted to make sure the citizens of the city wouldn't notice the launch in front of their eyes, so there would be no resistance."
"Ah, okay. Then what's the plan?"

***

6 and a half hours till launch

You and your friend were able to convince fellow foot enthusiasts to join your cause.

4 hours till launch

Infiltration of the weapon depot was successful. You and others from the club were able to receive the supplies and replace them with empty crates.

1 hour till launch

You taught the men fighting techniques such as how to hold a weapon (Never point it towards your face!), breathing exercises when aiming, etc. Your espionage friend disappeared; didn't leave a note saying why or where.

5 minutes till launch

***

All preparations had been set. You marched your men through the city. Some citizens joined you, others confused, and some trying to make a profit out of the situation. "Boots for sale! The most comfortable, reasonably priced, and highest quality boots for wartime. Boast as your friends envy your apparel as you march into battle! Buy now, and you'll get not one, but two, yes that right folks, two pairs of boots! Hurry while supplies last!" one merchant chanted enthusiastically from his store. You just marched ahead on the street, countering any resistance that dared cross your path. All of you took the stairs to surprise the enemy, and you all spilled out onto the surface. The general, along with a few scientists were preparing the giant bomb for takeoff.

"Ah, welcome to the party, gentleman," the general mused.
"It's over general. The gig is up," you said, eyeing him.
"Oh, ever can I do? You've got me cornered?" He cackled with laughter. "Things are not what they always seem, boy." He snapped his finger, and soldiers popped out of the tall grass, surrounding you and your men. Evidently, you were outnumbered 3-to-1. "I always have a backup plan just for situations like these. Now, drop your weapons." You and your men did as he asked.

"Good. It was a shame, really. You were a fine soldier, and I would've promoted you to be my right-hand man if you stuck around. However, I have to remove any threat that jeopardizes the mission." He pulled out his pistol, and pointed it at you. "I take it you were the mastermind behind this?"
"Yes, I am," you dully said.
"Why would you go to lengths for them?" He waved his pistol at his surroundings. "They are the enemy! All they want is to have you dead, and you're trying to save them?!"
"They're not what you think!" you bursted out, "They're loving, caring, and are a part of us. They deserve to live just as much as we do."

He looked at his gun, then back to you. "R...really?"
"Of course!"
He breathed a few deep breathes, his face stone cold. "Blasphemy." he whispered through his lips. His fingers reached for the trigger, and you saw your life flash before your eyes. Just when you thought you would feel the impact of a bullet, a shadow enveloped the general and you saw a foot come down from above. It was lightning fast, and it slammed down onto his body. She grind her foot, and you could see the general was no more. Gazing up, you saw your espionage friend and Larrissa. She smiled warmly and waved. The general's army that surrounded you put down their weapons in fear, and one of them hoisted up a white flag.

Your men shut down the bomb, and Larrissa lifted up her barefoot. The general layed there, a gruesome sight. It was fate that he would be squashed underfoot, just like his comrades.The soldiers escorted everyone, and carried the lifeless general back into the city.Your friend got onto the ground, and winked at you, entering the city also.

"Hey, your friend told me all I needed to know," she spoke.
"Ah, alright. You made it just in time too."
"Yeah, I guess I did." She smiled. "I'm just glad you're okay." She lowered her hand to the ground. "Com'on, let's go home. I got a surprise waiting for ya."
You hopped on top of it. "Okay." From there on, you headed on home.
